author: TNN
description: Election Commission officials defended the amendment restricting access to poll-day webcasting feeds, citing voter privacy and protection from intimidation. They emphasized that the footage is an internal tool, not for public sharing, aligning with legal obligations to protect voter secrecy.
title: EC: Sharing video footage of booth breaches voters' privacy

author: NEHA MADAAN
description: The India Meteorological Department has issued red and orange alerts for extremely heavy rainfall across several states in the coming week. Northwest India is expected to receive significant rainfall from June 21-27, with heavy showers in Jammu-Kashmir-Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand.
title: Heavy rainfall alerts in several northwest states as monsoon advances

author: SANDIP DIGHE
title: IAF airlifts organs from Pune to Delhi, helps save three lives

author: OMAR FAROOQ KHAN
description: Pakistan's government, led by Shehbaz Sharif, intends to formally nominate former US President Donald Trump for the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize. This decision stems from Trump's perceived diplomatic intervention during a recent military crisis with India, where his efforts are credited with de-escalating tensions and averting a wider conflict. Islamabad also lauded Trump's willingness to help resolve the Kashmir dispute.
title: Pakistan to nominate Trump for Peace Nobel over 'intervention' with India

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: A judges committee investigating the 'cash in kothi' case involving Justice Yashwant Varma has raised suspicions about an unidentified man seen near the burnt currency sacks. The panel suggests this individual may have collaborated with Justice Varma's staff to remove cash between 1 am and 7 am.
title: Panel probing Varma's house fire spotted 'unidentified man' near burnt cash

author: TNN
description: Gross direct tax collections saw a modest increase of under 5% up to June 19, with advance tax receipts growing at a muted 3.9%, signaling potential concerns about corporate profit growth. Net direct tax collections dipped slightly due to a significant surge in refunds, reflecting the finance minister's push for quicker disbursal.
title: Refunds, advance tax dip: Net direct mop-up down 1.4% to Rs 4.6 Lakh crore

author: OMAR FAROOQ KHAN
description: Pakistan refuted Indian media claims of requesting a ceasefire during the recent military standoff, asserting it responded decisively to Indian actions. Islamabad stated that de-escalation occurred only after interventions from the United States and Saudi Arabia, who conveyed India's willingness to halt hostilities if Pakistan reciprocated. While valuing peace, Pakistan affirmed its right to respond to any aggression.
title: 'Baseless': Pakistan denies ceasefire plea; credits US and Saudi role

author: NASEER GANAI AND SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh stated that Operation Sindoor, a response to the Pahalgam attack, was paused only after Pakistan requested a ceasefire, but it is not over. Singh warned Pakistan against supporting terror activities, emphasizing India's readiness to take action. He highlighted the importance of unity and the armed forces' commitment to yoga for discipline and focus.
title: Operation Sindoor not over, paused after Pakistan pleading: Rajnath Singh

author: TNN
description: A Royal Navy F-35 fighter jet remains grounded at Thiruvananthapuram airport due to a persistent hydraulic issue. Despite ongoing efforts by engineers from the aircraft carrier, the snag has not been resolved. There are plans to move the jet to a hangar, as specialized teams from the UK and the US are expected to inspect it, potentially extending its stay.
title: UK F-35 still in Kerala, engineers fail to fix hydraulic snag

author: NASEER GANAI
description: National Conference president Farooq Abdullah criticized the "dual power structure" in Jammu & Kashmir, blaming it for slow development. He warned that the party might approach the Supreme Court if statehood isn't restored soon. Sajad Lone supported the demand for statehood but criticized the NC's governance and concentration of power within the Chief Minister's Office.
title: Farooq warns of SC move if Jammu & Kashmir statehood not restored

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: A Financial Action Task Force report reveals Pakistan's alleged attempts to procure missile equipment by mislabeling shipments, raising concerns about its commitment to preventing weapons proliferation financing. The report links the importer to Pakistan's National Development Complex.
title: FATF flags Pakistan bid to ship in missile gear from China on sly

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Israel-Iran tension: B-2 bombers move from US, refueled shortly after take-off

author: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN
description: To facilitate the implementation of the Higher Education Commission of India (HECI), the Centre has formed a committee headed by former Isro chief K Radhakrishnan. Tasked with resolving implementation issues and harmonizing existing protocols, the 18-member committee includes directors from leading institutions and chairpersons of bodies like UGC and AICTE.
title: Isro ex-chief-led panel to onboard HEIs in new regulatory setup

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rumors swirl around Austin Reaves' future with the Lakers as the Utah Jazz express strong interest. A potential trade hinges on Utah's offer, particularly the inclusion of Walker Kessler. The Lakers are tempted by a package featuring Kessler's rim protection and Collin Sexton's scoring, addressing key team needs and potentially accelerating their championship pursuit around LeBron James and Luka Dončić.
title: Lakers consider trading Austin Reaves, Utah’s surprise offer turns heads

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant's explosive century and Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell initially put India in a commanding position at Headingley. However, Ollie Pope's resilient, unbeaten hundred, coupled with crucial partnerships, allowed England to weather the storm and reach 209 for 3 in response to India's 471. Despite a late breakthrough by Bumrah, England's grit, led by Pope, kept them in the game.
title: 1st Test: Pant’s flair, Bumrah’s fire, but Pope stands tall to keep England afloat

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Ollie Pope's resilient century kept England afloat on Day Two of the Headingley Test, responding to India's imposing 471. Jasprit Bumrah's three wickets rattled the English top order, but Pope's unbeaten 100* alongside Harry Brook's solid support, steered England to 209 for 3.
title: 'Aggressive doesn't mean he can't defend': Batting coach backs Pant, hails Gill's growth

author: DURGESH NANDAN JHA
description: A recent study reveals that nearly 20% of Indian households have all adults classified as overweight, while 10% are obese. States like Manipur and Kerala show over 30% of households with all adults overweight. Researchers emphasize the need for family-centered obesity prevention strategies, as obesity clusters within families significantly increase the risk of non-communicable diseases like diabetes and heart conditions.
title: All adults overweight in every 5th Indian household: Study

author: MANOJ CHAURASIA
title: Bihar election: Nitish hikes pension for widows, disabled, elderly by almost 3x

author: P NAVEEN
description: Bajirao, a five-year-old tiger, was captured after allegedly killing a tribal man in Seoni district, Madhya Pradesh. This incident, coupled with a previous fatal attack last November, triggered protests from villagers. Forest officials confirmed Bajirao's involvement through camera trap evidence and reported multiple encounters where the tiger charged at people.
title: Maneater tiger 'Bajirao' rescued from MP forest

author: MOHUA DAS
description: A recent national consultation highlighted the critical yet often overlooked role of probation officers (POs) in India's juvenile justice system. Overburdened and under-trained, POs struggle to provide adequate support and rehabilitation to children in conflict with the law.
title: One per 699: Probation-officer crunch leaves kids in conflict with law in the lurch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Jasprit Bumrah's relentless effort yielded three crucial wickets for India against England, who ended Day 2 at 209/3 in response to India's 471. Despite Bumrah's breakthroughs and missed opportunities, Ollie Pope's century steadied England.
title: IND vs ENG: Drama at Headingley! Jasprit Bumrah denied wicket by shocking no-ball call

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: On Day 2 of the Headingley Test, Mohammed Siraj's spirited bowling went unrewarded. England fought back, led by Josh Tongue's 4 for 86, causing an Indian collapse from 430/3 to 471 all out. Rishabh Pant's spectacular 146-ball century, featuring signature somersaults, and Shubman Gill's classy 147 were highlights before Tongue dismantled the tail post-lunch, swiftly ending India's innings.
title: IND vs ENG: DSP Siraj turns detective! He grabs England batter's bat and inspects it during Headingley Test - WATCH

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Adult websites in France, including Pornhub, briefly went offline to protest a new age verification law requiring government-issued IDs or credit cards. Aylo, Pornhub's parent company, argued the law posed security risks and advocates for device-level verification by tech giants.
title: Pornhub and sister websites: Back online in France after court ruling

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Jasprit Bumrah's crucial breakthroughs on Day 2 against England, including Ben Duckett's key wicket, propelled India forward. Despite a batting slump, Bumrah's early wicket of Zak Crawley set a positive tone. Surpassing Wasim Akram, Bumrah now holds the record for most wickets by an Asian bowler in SENA countries with 147, solidifying his status as India's premier overseas fast-bowling export.
title: IND vs ENG: History at Headingley! Jasprit Bumrah breaks Wasim Akram's record

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sachin Tendulkar praised Rishabh Pant's innovative paddle sweep, calling it a calculated move, not an accident. He also noted Shubman Gill and Pant's on-field communication tactics to disrupt the bowler. Their 209-run partnership followed Yashasvi Jaiswal's century, putting England's bowlers under pressure. Gill scored 147, while Pant reached his century with a six before India's innings concluded at 471.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Shubman-Pant were speaking loudly in Hindi' - Tendulkar reveals genius 'mind game' vs England

title: Israel-Iran war: US moves B-2 bombers to Guam

title: Patna-bound Air India Express flight diverted due to adverse weather conditions

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Fans across the NHL are beginning to express outrage as the Florida Panthers take repeated shots at Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid during their Stanley Cup celebrations. From mocking his team’s playoff anthem to provocative comments and viral party footage, many feel the disrespect has crossed a line and gone too far.
title: Stanley Cup win turns sour: Florida Panthers mock Connor McDavid in viral celebrations

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Vanessa Bryant commemorated her youngest daughter Capri's 6th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post, sharing cherished memories and expressing her love. Since the tragic loss of Kobe Bryant and Gianna, Vanessa has dedicated herself to being a strong and supportive figure for her daughters.
title: 'My Sweet Koko Bean': Vanessa Bryant pens a heart-touching post for daughter

author: TNN
title: 34-year-old Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar found dead in Mumbai flat

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Air India has initiated interim compensation of Rs 25 lakh each for the families of the deceased and survivors of the Ahmedabad plane crash on June 12. Payments have been made to three families, with others being processed. This is in addition to the Rs 1 crore compensation from Tata Sons.
title: Ahmedabad crash aftermath: Air India begins Rs 25 lakh interim payouts

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'If US joins Israel against Iran ... ': Houthis' stark warning to America- video

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Brittany Mahomes enjoyed a concert with Travis Kelce and friends. Patrick Mahomes and Taylor Swift were absent from shared photos. This get-together highlighted the strong bond within the Kansas City Chiefs' circle. It happened after Kelce and Swift's appearance at the Stanley Cup Final. The event showcased the camaraderie beyond football. The Chiefs aim for another championship run.
title: Brittany Mahomes steps out, ditches Patrick for night with Travis Kelce

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The first Test between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh ended in a tense draw, marked by a delayed declaration from Bangladesh and a resilient Sri Lankan defense. Amidst the on-field drama, a snake charmer with cobras and a monkey added a surreal touch to the 'Naagin Derby'. Najmul Hossain Shanto's twin centuries and Nayeem Hasan's five-wicket haul highlighted the high-scoring affair.
title: Bizarre! Fan shows up with two cobras and a monkey during Test match - viral moment

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sanjay Manjrekar lauded Rishabh Pant as India's greatest wicketkeeper-batter after his stunning century against England. Pant's remarkable innings broke records, surpassing MS Dhoni with the most Test centuries by an Indian wicketkeeper. His fifth Test century in SENA countries also set a new benchmark for Asian batters, solidifying his reputation in challenging overseas conditions.
title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant better than MS Dhoni? Ex-India cricketer says YES after Headingley heroics

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: When filing income tax returns for AY 2025-26, understanding capital gains taxation from mutual funds is crucial. Both old and new tax regimes tax these gains. Long-term gains from equity funds are taxed at 12.50% (exceeding Rs 1.25 lakh), while short-term gains are taxed at 20%.
title: ITR: Are capital gains from MFs taxed differently? New LTCG, STCG rules

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A Delhi musician's quest for authentic Bengaluru cuisine led to an unexpected and heartwarming encounter with an elderly couple. He requested a home-cooked breakfast, and they welcomed him with open arms, sharing food, music, and heartfelt conversation. The video of this cross-cultural exchange, celebrating the unifying power of food, has gone viral, highlighting the kindness and warmth of human connection.
title: 'People are too sweet in Bengaluru': Old couple invites creator for 'local homely food'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In Gaza, Palestinians face life-threatening conditions daily in their desperate search for food, amidst scarce aid and escalating violence. Israeli troops have reportedly opened fire near aid routes, while looters target those carrying supplies. The UN warns of an apocalyptic situation, with aid insufficient to prevent starvation as desperate residents risk everything for basic necessities.
title: 'This ain't aid, it's death': Gaza food distribution plagued by violence and shortage

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke emphasizes the importance of developers retaining hands-on coding skills alongside AI tools. He warns against over-reliance on AI-generated code, advocating for a flexible workflow where developers can seamlessly switch between AI assistance and direct coding.
title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: ‘Key for winning’ AI coding tools is in ….

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A hot air balloon accident in Praia Grande, Brazil resulted in multiple fatalities. Initial reports confirm eight deaths. Rescue teams are searching for other passengers. The balloon caught fire mid-air before crashing. Two survivors are receiving medical care. Jorginho Mello, the state governor, expressed shock. An investigation into the cause of the fire is underway. Authorities are working to identify the victims. The incident raises concerns about flight safety.
title: 8 killed in Brazil hot air balloon horror; video shows blaze in sky

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Sonam Raghuvanshi and Raj Kushwaha have been remanded to judicial custody for the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi during their honeymoon in Meghalaya. Arrested along with three accomplices, they are under investigation by a special team. The victim's family alleges a conspiracy, demanding further investigation and narcoanalysis tests to uncover the motive behind the murder.
title: Honeymoon murder case: Meghalaya court remands Sonam, Raj to 13-day judicial custody

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Only Rishabh Pant can clear the ropes comfortably with the one hand coming off, only he can deflate the opposition in a single session of audacious stroke play. He brought up his Test century No 7 with a one-handed six over mid-on. He celebrated with a somersault, entertained the crowd further as the showstopper put on an another box-office performance on the England soil.
title: IND vs ENG | Pant's love story with No. 5 - a batting romance born in 2016

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravi Shastri lauded Rishabh Pant's impressive century in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy Test. Pant surpassed MS Dhoni with his seventh Test century. Shastri described Pant as an 'outrageous' and entertaining player. Sunil Gavaskar praised Pant's century, contrasting with earlier criticism. Shastri noted India's aggressive run rate. He hoped for overcast conditions to aid India's bowling attack.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Rishabh Pant has his own computer' — Ravi Shastri breaks down what makes him special

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Facing an uncertain future amid escalating tensions, Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has reportedly designated three senior clerics as potential successors, signaling a shift away from dynastic succession by excluding his son, Mojtaba. This unprecedented move coincides with Khamenei's retreat to a secure bunker following threats from the US and Israel, highlighting the fragility surrounding Iran's leadership.
title: Iran's Supreme era coming to end? Khamenei names successors; son's name missing

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: US updates travel advisory for India, asks women not to travel alone

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A senior Israeli military official confirmed a second wave of strikes on Iran's Isfahan nuclear facility, targeting centrifuge production sites. These renewed attacks follow initial airstrikes on June 13, aiming to cripple Iran's uranium enrichment capabilities. Alongside Isfahan, Natanz and Fordo were also targeted, escalating the shadow war and raising concerns about regional stability.
title: Watch: Israel strikes Iran's Isfahan nuclear site again

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's impressive Test captaincy debut at Headingley was slightly overshadowed when he sported black socks, violating ICC regulations mandating white, cream, or light grey. While his career-best 147 anchored India's innings, the sock choice drew attention, potentially leading to a reprimand or fine.
title: 1st Test Day 2: Is Gill still wearing black socks? What if he's found guilty?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amidst rising Middle East tensions, the Indian embassy in Israel refuted claims of forcing Indian citizens to leave, dismissing a fake social media post. The embassy encouraged citizens to rely on official channels for accurate updates and register for assistance.
title: Are Indians being forced to leave Israel? What embassy said

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Cognizant will establish a major IT campus in Visakhapatnam, securing 21.31 acres of land from the Andhra Pradesh government for a nominal price. The company plans to invest Rs 1,582 crore in the project, which is expected to generate 8,000 jobs over the next eight years. This move aligns with Andhra Pradesh's vision to transform Visakhapatnam into a technology hub.
title: Conginzant’s 99 paise deal: IT giant grabs 21.31 acres land in Andhra: What the deal is

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Nitin Gadkari hinted at a larger role in 2029, framing his past contributions as a mere "news reel" compared to the "real film" yet to come. He emphasized party loyalty and his commitment to assigned duties, while prioritizing initiatives to prevent farmer suicides in Vidarbha. Gadkari also cited population growth as a barrier to India's economic progress.
title: Gadkari calls work done till now 'news reel'; adds 'film abhi baaki hain'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut began spectacularly as India dominated England in Leeds. Yashasvi Jaiswal scored a century on his first English innings, while Gill made his maiden overseas Test century, both achieving unique milestones. India ended day one at 359/3, aiming to build a massive first-innings lead, reminiscent of their victorious 2002 Leeds performance.
title: IND vs ENG: India's highest Test totals in England: Can Shubman's team break the record at Leeds?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant captivated Headingley with a dazzling century, punctuated by a viral front-flip celebration. His aggressive innings, featuring 10 fours and four sixes, propelled India past 400, supported by Shubman Gill's century. Pant's acrobatic display, reminiscent of his IPL antics, underscored his triumphant comeback from injury, adding a memorable moment to the Test match.
title: IND vs ENG: Pant's front-flip celebration after century goes viral - Watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill captained India in the first Test against England at Headingley, urging his team to secure an early victory after a dominant batting performance. India posted 471 in their first innings, propelled by centuries from Gill (147), Rishabh Pant (134), and Yashasvi Jaiswal (101).
title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill's first pep talk as Test captain fired up Team India – WATCH

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India is looking to reduce its reliance on China for rare earth minerals with a Rs 3,500-Rs 5,000 crore scheme to boost domestic production. This initiative comes as China's export restrictions on rare earths have raised concerns in the Indian automotive and renewable energy sectors.
title: Reducing dependence, countering China: India’s scheme for rare earth minerals

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson addressed frequent flyers after the tragic crash of Flight AI171 on June 12, 2025, which resulted in the loss of 241 lives. Wilson expressed deep sorrow and committed to supporting affected families and cooperating with investigations. Enhanced safety inspections are underway, leading to temporary flight reductions to prioritize safety and maintain customer trust.
title: Air India CEO Campbell Willson's letter: 'We are reaching out with …'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Bihar polls: 'JDU tickets will be distributed by Amit Shah,' says Tejashwi

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Delhi experienced a welcome change in weather as rain showers swept through various areas. RK Puram, Dhaula Kuan, and Delhi Cantt saw significant downpours. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert, forecasting rainfall from Friday to Monday. The monsoon is approaching the National Capital Region, with an expected arrival by June 24.
title: Delhi weather: Sudden rain brings relief to capital; IMD issues yellow alert

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.1 hit northern Iran. This event occurred amidst ongoing Israeli airstrikes. Some analysts speculate a possible link to Iran's nuclear program. Semnan province, near the epicenter, houses key nuclear and missile infrastructure. Iran denies pursuing nuclear weapons. The incident has heightened tensions in West Asia. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of the tremor.
title: Did Israel strikes trigger earthquake in Tehran? Tremors could be linked to Iran nukes

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant's audacious century at Headingley marked a significant turnaround, silencing past criticism from Sunil Gavaskar. Pant's measured approach, combining patience with aggressive strokes, allowed him to dominate the tiring bowlers. His partnership with Shubman Gill put India in a commanding position, transforming critique into admiration.
title: From 'stupid, stupid' to 'superb, superb' - Gavaskar lauds Pant's hundred

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: After an eight-year wait, Karun Nair's Test comeback was short-lived as he was dismissed for a duck by Ben Stokes. Nair, who previously scored a triple century against England in 2016, earned his recall after impressive domestic performances. Despite the disappointing return, he cherished receiving his comeback cap from Sunil Gavaskar.
title: IND vs ENG: 3011-day wait ends in heartbreak! Karun Nair falls for four-ball duck on Test comeback

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill marked his Test captaincy debut with a brilliant 147 against England at Headingley, leading India's charge in the first Test. Despite falling short of a double century due to a mistimed shot, his innings was crucial in India's quest for an early series advantage.
title: IND vs ENG: Emotional scenes! Shubman Gill breaks down after scoring 147

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant's on-field camaraderie shone through during India's dominant batting display at Headingley. Gill's witty comment on Pant's elegant leave was caught on the stump mic, delighting fans. Pant, in turn, cautioned Gill about a risky shot, showcasing their mutual understanding and contributing to a defining 200-plus run partnership.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Kya hi baat hai teri bhai' - Gill’s banter with Pant lights up Day 2

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A public dispute has erupted within the US national security apparatus as Tulsi Gabbard adjusted her assessment of Iran's nuclear ambitions, following a direct contradiction from President Trump. Gabbard now acknowledges Iran could potentially develop a nuclear weapon within weeks to months if it chooses to proceed, a revision prompted by the president's strong disagreement and amidst ongoing tensions regarding the Iran-Israel conflict.
title: Spy chief flip-flop? After Trump's 2nd rebuke over Iran intel, Tulsi Gabbard shifts tone

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized the Modi government's silence on Israel's actions in Gaza and its strike on Iran, calling it a departure from India's diplomatic traditions. She accused the government of abandoning its commitment to a two-state solution and failing to condemn Israel's escalation, urging India to use its diplomatic leverage to promote dialogue and de-escalation in West Asia.
title: ‘Disturbing departure from moral traditions’: Sonia Gandhi on govt silence on Gaza, Iran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump has repeatedly stated he will decide whether to launch a military strike on Iran within the next two weeks. This timeline echoes a pattern from his first term, where he frequently used the "two weeks" promise for various announcements that often failed to materialize.
title: 'Giving them two weeks': Trump’s timeless countdown returns; this time with Iran

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant's impressive record in England continued as he scored his seventh Test century at Headingley in Leeds. Pant reached his century in 119 balls, marking his slowest Test century. This was his fourth century against England and his third on English soil, solidifying his reputation as a premier red-ball batter for India.
title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant breaks MS Dhoni's record, slams seventh Test century

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Irfan Shaikh, a 22-year-old Air India crew member who perished in the Ahmedabad plane crash last week, was laid to rest in Pimpri Chinchwad on Saturday. His remains were identified through DNA matching. The London-bound AI 171 crashed shortly after takeoff, killing all 241 on board and 29 on the ground.
title: Air India crash crew member Irfan Shaikh laid to rest after DNA match

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Banarasi sarees, originating from Varanasi, are exquisite silk heirlooms steeped in history and culture, blending Indian traditions with Mughal artistry. These sarees, known for intricate craftsmanship and luxurious fabrics like silk and zari, feature diverse styles and motifs, holding cultural significance and social status. Despite challenges from machine-made imitations, initiatives promote sustainability to preserve this timeless craft.
title: Banarasi sarees: What makes them special? Here are 10 reasons for their everlasting charm

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the Election Commission, alleging a lack of transparency and the destruction of vital election data. The EC defended its decision to erase CCTV footage 45 days post-election, citing voter privacy and potential misuse. Officials stated that releasing webcasting footage could compromise voter security and contravene legal provisions, despite claims of promoting democratic integrity.
title: 'Destroying evidence': Rahul Gandhi targets EC again; poll body reacts

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.
title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's impressive Test captaincy debut, marked by a brilliant century against England, is slightly overshadowed by a potential ICC violation. Gill was seen wearing black socks, breaching regulations that mandate white, cream, or light grey socks. This fashion faux pas could lead to a reprimand or fine, despite his stellar performance and India's dominant position at 359/3 at stumps.
title: IND vs ENG: Did Shubman Gill break rules? ICC rulebook provides clarity

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's unbeaten century, complemented by Yashasvi Jaiswal's ton, propelled India to a dominant position on Day 1 of the opening Test against England at Headingley. India finished at 359 for 3 after being put into bat, with Rishabh Pant adding late fireworks. Stuart Broad criticized England's bowling tactics, suggesting adjustments to their field settings and lengths.
title: IND vs ENG: Stuart Broad rips into England bowlers, says 'they didn't quite get it right'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warns American businesses about a critical skills shortage, not just a worker shortage. He urges corporate leaders to collaborate with schools to bridge the talent gap in cybersecurity, coding, and financial literacy. Dimon advocates for companies to invest in education pipelines and promote curricula that integrate job-ready skills with academics to foster economic growth.
title: Jamie Dimon to American companies: You are really short of the skills you need

author: TNN
description: In Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, a dispute over public urination near a poultry shop escalated into a fatal cleaver attack, resulting in the death of Nitin Sankpal and injuries to two others. Police arrested five individuals, including the shop owner, Mastan Qureshi.
title: Man hacked to death for urinating near chicken shop

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi suggests the United States might be using negotiations as a cover for a planned attack on Iran, questioning America's commitment to diplomacy. He accuses Washington of betrayal, especially after Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear targets just before scheduled talks. Araghchi states Iran is willing to negotiate, but demands Israel cease its aerial attacks first.
title: 'Maybe US wants to attack anyway': Iran foreign minister on Trump's 2-week window

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A dispute has erupted among northern states over the central government's plan to divert surplus water from the Indus system. Jammu and Kashmir's chief minister Omar Abdullah opposes redirecting water to Punjab, citing drought-like conditions in his region. This stance has drawn criticism from Punjab's Congress MP, who emphasised Punjab's patriotism and contributions to national security.
title: 'Will never permit': J&K CM on Indus diversion to Punjab; ally Cong fumes

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India dominated Day 1 of the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds, reaching 359/3. Shubman Gill's unbeaten 127 and Rishabh Pant's 65 put England's bowling under pressure. However, the weather forecast predicts thunderstorms, potentially disrupting play later in the day after Yashasvi Jaiswal also scored a century.
title: Headingley weather: Will rain play spoilsport on Day 2? Latest weather in Leeds

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill, facing initial skepticism as India's Test captain, silenced critics with a remarkable unbeaten century on the first day of the Leeds Test. Alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's century, Gill propelled India to a strong position of 359 for 3 at stumps. Gill's achievement places him among Indian legends who scored centuries in their first Test as captain.
title: IND vs ENG: 'He comes from Punjab ...' - Bharat Army's new song for Gill

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India dominated day one of the first Test against England, concluding at 359/3. Shubman Gill led with an unbeaten 127, supported by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and Rishabh Pant's aggressive 65. Pant even advised caution to Gill, captured by the stump mic. This strong start marks a promising beginning for India in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, showcasing their batting prowess.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Neeche hi reh ... ' - Rishabh Pant's stump-mic warning to Shubman Gill goes viral during Leeds Test

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Before the Test series, Stuart Broad voiced concerns about England's inexperienced bowling attack. His worries proved valid as India dominated Day 1, reaching 350 for 3 with centuries from Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal. Tim Southee defended Ben Stokes' decision to bowl first, despite criticism from Michael Vaughan, highlighting the team's thought process behind the choice.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Where are they getting 20 wickets?' Broad sounds alarm bells

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A US diplomat, Dorothy Shea, created a stir at a UN Security Council meeting by mistakenly blaming Israel for regional chaos before correcting herself to point the finger at Iran. Despite the gaffe, Shea reaffirmed US support for Israel, particularly regarding actions against Iran's nuclear ambitions.
title: 'Israel spreading terror': Slip-up by US envoy to UN goes viral; watch video

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: The State Bank of India (SBI) has reopened applications for 2,964 Circle Based Officer (CBO) posts under Advertisement No. CRPD/CBO/2025-26/03. Candidates from Arunachal Pradesh and Nagaland with English as a subject in Class 10 or 12 are now eligible for the North East Circle. The application window is open from June 21 to June 30, 2025. Selection involves an Online Test, Interview, and Language Test. Eligible candidates must have a graduate degree and two years of officer-level experience.
title: SBI reopens officer jobs: Class 10/12 English now counts; 2,964 posts up for grabs

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The IDF announced the killing of Behnam Shahriyari, commander of the Quds Force's Weapons Transfer Unit, responsible for funneling weapons and funds to Iranian proxies. Saeed Izadi, a senior IRGC commander and key liaison with Hamas, was also eliminated in a separate strike.
title: Watch: Moment Israel kills Iran’s ‘weapons kingpin’ in deep strike inside Tehran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Following Israeli airstrikes on Iran, Iranians abroad are met with robotic voices when calling home due to a widespread communication blackout. These AI messages, ranging from unsettling to strangely comforting, are suspected to be a government tactic to prevent hacking or spread confusion.
title: 'Who are you?' AI voices answer calls of Iranian disapora trying to contact kin

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sunil Gavaskar has changed his view on Rishabh Pant's batting. He praised Pant's measured approach in the recent Test match. Gavaskar noted Pant's ability to balance defence and attack. Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal also performed well. India ended Day 1 with a strong score of 359/3. Pant remained not out at 65, hitting two sixes.
title: After ‘stupid, stupid!’ remark in Australia, Gavaskar makes new Pant admission: 'It seems like ...'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Priyanka Kharge, Karnataka minister, announced that the Union government reversed its decision. He received permission for an official US visit. The Ministry of External Affairs issued an NOC after initially denying clearance. Kharge questioned the initial denial and timing. He highlighted Karnataka's role in national initiatives. He also emphasized the need for answers from the central government regarding the matter.
title: 'Because it became public?': Priyank Kharge questions MEA's U-turn on US visit

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India dominated Day 1 of the first Test against England, reaching 359 for 3 at stumps, thanks to centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill. The pair's 123-run partnership steadied the innings after India lost two quick wickets. A near run-out incident involving Gill added drama, followed by lighthearted banter between Jaiswal and Gill regarding running between the wickets.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Bhaiya yaar...' - Watch Jaiswal's frustrated reaction after Gill says 'no'

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: High-protein diets, popular for weight loss, pose hidden risks to kidney health. Dr. Bhanu Mishra warns that excessive protein intake forces kidneys to overwork, potentially causing long-term damage, especially for those with or at risk of kidney disease. Overconsumption, particularly of animal proteins, can disrupt acid-base balance and impair kidney function.
title: Protein overload and kidneys: The silent strain you didn’t see coming

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Air India crash: DGCA orders airlines to remove 3 senior officials from key roles

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Nitish Kumar, Bihar's chief minister, has declared an increase to the state's Social Security Pension Scheme. The monthly pension will rise from Rs 400 to Rs 1100. This benefits elderly citizens, persons with disabilities, and widowed women. The revised scheme starts in July. The government will directly transfer the funds to beneficiaries' accounts monthly.
title: Bihar polls: Nitish Kumar hikes pension; move to benefit over 1 crore

author: TOI Education
description: Applying early for international studies offers advantages like higher admission and scholarship chances, along with ample time for visa and housing arrangements. Late applications can work if used to strengthen profiles or sort finances, but risks include fewer program seats, limited funding, and potential visa delays. Assess readiness to decide the optimal application time.
title: Early vs. late college applications: When should you apply to study abroad?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut at Headingley, marked by an unbeaten century, has brought back memories of his verbal sparring with Jonny Bairstow during the 2024 India-England series. The resurfaced clip shows a sharp exchange between the two, adding spice to the ongoing series where Gill's leadership and batting acumen signal a confident start for India.
title: IND vs ENG: Gill, Bairstow's heated sledging war resurfaces - viral video

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's unbeaten 127 propelled India to 359 for 3 on Day 1 against England at Headingley, marking a stellar start to his Test captaincy. Gill remarkably used a repaired bat, fixed by Cricfix_batservices after it was damaged in training.
title: IND vs ENG: How Shubman Gill got his century-hitting bat fixed - watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Japan has called off a key meeting with the United States. This decision followed a demand from Washington for Tokyo to significantly increase its defense spending. The US wanted Japan to raise its defense budget to 3.5 percent of GDP. An upcoming election in Japan also influenced the decision to postpone the security talks.
title: Japan snubs US: Why Tokyo pulled plug on 2+2 security talks

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A dispute on the New Delhi-Bhopal Vande Bharat Express led to the filing of a non-cognizable report by BJP MLA Rajeev Singh. The incident, involving a disagreement over seats and an 'objectionable' posture, escalated at Jhansi station. A passenger was allegedly assaulted by individuals linked to Singh.
title: Vande Bharat scuffle: BJP MLA alleges abuse; passenger claims assault by associates

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi's 'Make in India' initiative. He points to low manufacturing rates and high youth unemployment. Gandhi highlights increased imports from China. He shares a video interacting with young people in Delhi. Gandhi alleges the PLI scheme is being rolled back. He calls for reforms and financial support for local producers.
title: 'We assemble, China profits': Rahul slams 'Make in India'; takes shot at PM Modi

author: SABI HUSSAIN
description: India faces a significant challenge in combating doping, as evidenced by the latest Wada report, which ranks the nation first globally in dope offenders with 214 adverse analytical findings in 2023. This alarming situation has prompted authorities to revive the 'National Anti-Doping Bill 2022', incorporating Wada's suggestions to avoid potential suspension of NADA.
title: Global shame! India tops WADA doping list; ministry plans stricter actions

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, India has extended its evacuation operation, 'Operation Sindhu,' to include citizens of Nepal and Sri Lanka, following formal requests. The Indian Embassy in Tehran has provided emergency contact information for those seeking assistance.
title: India widens Op Sindhu ambit, will evacuate citizens of Nepal & Sri Lanka from Iran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Kanishka bombing: Canada police identifies 'Mr X'; refuses to disclose identity

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: RJ Mahvash has directly addressed online trolls who attributed her success to her association with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal. She refuted these claims by showcasing her career achievements since 2019 in a video posted on social media.
title: RJ Mahvash, linked with Chahal, shuts down trolls: 'Sine 2019, I've been ...'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma, known for his calm batting approach, recently shared his mindset, emphasising instinctive responses over fixed targets. He also highlighted emotional control in high-pressure games. Sharma has retired from Test cricket after scoring 4,301 runs in 67 matches, including 12 centuries. India now have a new red-ball captain in Shubman Gill for the Test series in England.
title: Rohit Sharma: 'While batting, I don't think of ... ' - Watch video

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde linked International Yoga Day to his 2022 Shiv Sena rebellion, terming it a "big yoga" that reshaped the state's political landscape. He stated that the split led to stability and development under the guidance of PM Modi and Amit Shah.
title: We did 'bada yoga': Shinde recalls Shiv Sena split; takes dig at Uddhav

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: A new study models a chilling scenario: a world where humans stop having children. The research indicates that within a century, the human species could face near extinction due to biological stagnation, leading to societal collapse. The absence of younger generations would cripple essential systems like food production, healthcare, and infrastructure, ultimately halting civilization.
title: What if no one had kids? Society collapses by year 80; study warns of quiet extinction

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Vladimir Putin declared Russians and Ukrainians as "one people," implying Russia's claim over Ukraine, while denying intentions to destroy the country. He stated that peace hinges on Ukraine accepting Russia's territorial gains and neutrality. Putin warned Ukraine against using a "dirty bomb," threatening a catastrophic response, amidst ongoing Russian military actions and accusations of Ukrainian shelling.
title: 'Whole of Ukraine is ours’: Putin claims; issues 'last mistake' warning

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following her divorce from Tom Brady, Gisele Bündchen has not only reclaimed her modeling career but has also significantly expanded her business empire. Her net worth now surpasses Brady's, driven by lucrative endorsements, successful ventures like Sejaa and Ipanema, and strategic real estate investments. Bündchen's post-divorce success showcases her financial acumen and ability to reinvent herself.
title: Gisele Bündchen wealth: Now $100 million richer than Tom Brady

author: NIKHIL SHARMA
description: Faridabad police unearthed the decomposed body of Tanu Rajput, a 25-year-old woman, from a pit outside her in-laws' house in Roshan Nagar, nearly two months after her disappearance. Her husband, Arun Singh, and his parents are suspected of murdering her and burying her body.
title: 'Covered trench with plastic': Wife killed, buried in 10-foot-deep pit outside home

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a dramatic Eliminator in Maharashtra's premier T20 league, Vicky Ostwal survived a bizarre fielding error. Kolhapur Tuskers missed a crucial run-out opportunity. Ostwal then scored 74 runs. Raigad Royals defeated Kolhapur Tuskers. The Royals advanced to Qualifier 2. They will now face Puneri Bappa. Ostwal's lucky break became a viral moment. Kolhapur will remember this costly mistake.
title: 'Every player should retire immediately': Never-seen-before drama in cricket field - Watch

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Eggs are nutritional powerhouses, packed with vitamins, protein, and healthy fats, offering numerous health benefits. Regular consumption supports heart health by boosting good cholesterol, enhances brain function with choline, and promotes eye health with antioxidants. Furthermore, eggs contribute to stronger bones, healthier hair and skin, weight management, muscle strength, a robust immune system, and increased levels of good cholesterol.
title: From thick hair to strong bones: 10 benefits of eating eggs daily

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Gailard Sartain, celebrated for his comedic performances on Hee Haw and roles in films like Fried Green Tomatoes and Mississippi Burning, has died at 78. His career began with sketch comedy before his big break on Hee Haw, where he played Sheriff Orville P. Bullmoose. Sartain was also a respected artist and illustrator, designing album covers and contributing to national magazines.
title: Gailard Sartain: ‘Fried Green Tomatoes’ actor, passes away at 78

author: TNN
description: Tata Motors faces a potential $2.1 billion tariff hit on Jaguar Land Rover due to new US trade measures, according to Chairman N Chandrasekaran. Mitigation plans aim to reduce this impact to $790 million. Chandrasekaran addressed shareholders at Tata Motors' AGM, his first appearance since the Air India flight incident.
title: Jaguar Land Rover to face $2.1billion tariff hit: N Chandrasekaran

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following India's impressive Day 1 performance at Headingley, the BCCI shared a conversation revealing Yashasvi Jaiswal's mindset. Jaiswal emphasizes his dedication to the team and rigorous practice, embracing pressure situations to succeed in challenging conditions like England. His focus and calm demeanor off the field contribute to his remarkable achievements.
title: 'No matter what, I wanted runs in Eng': Jurel discloses Jaiswal's stubborn side; watch video

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump asserted his role in resolving global conflicts, including India-Pakistan tensions, claiming he deserves a Nobel Peace Prize, which he believes he won't receive. He highlighted his involvement in Serbia-Kosovo, Egypt-Ethiopia, and the Abraham Accords. However, India has firmly denied any foreign mediation in its engagement with Pakistan, emphasizing direct military-to-military dialogue for de-escalation.
title: 'Won't get Nobel': Trump again claims credit for India-Pak de-escalation

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Defence minister Rajnath Singh issued a stern warning to Pakistan, stating that 'Operation Sindoor' is ongoing and any future terror attacks will face severe consequences. He emphasized India's readiness to take action against terrorism, highlighting Operation Sindoor as a message that continued aggression will not be tolerated.
title: 'Any attack ...': Rajnath Singh warns Pakistan 'Op Sindoor not over'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A Financial Action Task Force (FATF) report exposed Pakistan's missile development program, citing a 2020 seizure of dual-use goods bound for Karachi. The shipment, intercepted by Indian customs, contained equipment critical for ballistic missile technology mis-declared in export documents and linked to Pakistan’s National Development Complex. This disclosure intensifies scrutiny of state-sponsored terrorism, potentially leading to renewed calls for sanctions.
title: Big win for India: FATF cites Pak as example of nations flouting weapons control norms

author: SANJEEV DEVASIA
description: Following a complaint about potential coastal regulation zone violations during renovations, a joint team of forest department and BMC officials inspected Shah Rukh Khan's bungalow, Mannat. The inspection included both the heritage structure and the annex building. Officials will prepare a report based on their findings after reviewing documents provided by Khan's staff regarding the permissions obtained for the renovation.
title: Forest depertment, Mumbai civic body visit SRK's home over complaints of CRZ violations

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India dominated Day 1 against England at Headingley, reaching 359/3, fuelled by centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, who was surprisingly elevated to captain. Jaiswal's impressive form continued with his fifth Test hundred, while Gill and Rishabh Pant's unbroken partnership further solidified India's strong position.
title: IND vs ENG: KL Rahul welcomes Pant with folded hands - watch video

author: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN
description: India's school education performance gap narrowed from 51% to 42% between 2018 and 2024, signaling progress across states. The Education Ministry's PGI 2.0 reveals that while no state reached the top grades, Chandigarh led with the highest score. Punjab, Delhi, and Gujarat followed, while several states need improvements.
title: No state/UT gets top grades in govt school performance index

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant achieved a milestone at Headingley. He is now the fastest Asian wicketkeeper-batter to score 3000 Test runs. Pant reached this feat in his 76th innings. He surpassed legends like MS Dhoni and Kumar Sangakkara. Pant's aggressive batting style has made him a global favorite. He also scored a quick 65* on Day 1.
title: Pant surpasses MS Dhoni, Sangakkara to become first in Asia to...

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations in Visakhapatnam, emphasizing yoga's role in fostering peace amidst global tensions. He highlighted yoga's universal appeal, transcending boundaries and uniting humanity.
title: 'Yoga is pause button': PM's strong message for world 'going through unrest'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The celebrated friendship between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively is reportedly strained due to a $400 million lawsuit involving Justin Baldoni and Lively. Private text messages from Lively, presented in court, have allegedly wounded Swift, exposing a side of Lively she hadn't anticipated.
title: Taylor Swift breaks from Blake Lively: Betrayal in $400M lawsuit

author: TNN
description: An Air India flight experienced a hissing sound from a door panel mid-flight, attributed to a potential seal compromise causing pressurized air leakage. Despite the noise, safety parameters remained compliant, and the aircraft was cleared after checks in Hong Kong.
title: All safety parameters were found to be in compliance: Air India

author: TNN
description: Delhi is expected to welcome the southwest monsoon around June 24, three days ahead of schedule, with forecasts predicting a normal monsoon season. While the country anticipates above-normal rainfall, Delhi and surrounding regions are likely to receive rainfall within the normal range.
title: Early monsoon in Delhi; likely to arrive by June 24: IMD

author: TNN
description: The ED uncovered 322 bank passbooks linked to mule accounts used to divert government funds under the guise of legitimate transactions related to Delhi classrooms construction. These accounts, opened in the names of laborers, were allegedly used to misappropriate funds exceeding Rs 2,000 crore.
title: ED claims new evidence in city classroom 'scam'

author: MANJU V
description: An Air India flight from Delhi to Hong Kong experienced a mid-air door malfunction, causing unsettling noises and shaking. Flight attendants used napkins to mitigate the issue, and the flight landed safely. Similar incidents have occurred on Boeing 787s previously, though experts assure that such door issues don't compromise flight safety, highlighting the redundancy in safety measures.
title: ‘Hissing door mid-air’: AI flight to Hong Kong spooks flyers; crew use napkins to 'fix' issue

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: During the India vs England Test, Sanjay Manjrekar's commentary sparked controversy with a remark seemingly aimed at Virat Kohli's off-stump struggles. While praising KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal, Manjrekar alluded to a 'former batter' prone to chasing wide deliveries. This subtle dig surfaced shortly after Kohli's Test retirement, even as Gill and Jaiswal shone with impressive centuries.
title: IND vs ENG: Manjrekar roasts Kohli during commentary; video goes viral

author: TNN
description: India's Operation Sindhu is underway to evacuate stranded citizens from Iran, with two special flights expected in Delhi. Tehran, in a special gesture, lifted airspace restrictions for the evacuation facilitated by Mahan Air. Around 1,000 students will return in the coming days. Evacuation flights for Indian nationals wishing to leave Israel will commence from Amman.
title: India will start operating evacuation flights from Israel from tomorrow

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions, Israel intensified its military campaign against Iran, targeting missile infrastructure, while the US considers intervention. Diplomatic efforts falter as Iran accuses the US of using talks as a cover for Israeli strikes, refusing negotiations until aggression ceases. Missile attacks persist, resulting in mounting civilian casualties and raising concerns about regional stability.
title: Israel-Iran: Trump repeats 2-week warning; Tehran slams ‘betrayal to diplomacy’ – 10 points

author: SUBRATA CHATTORAJ
description: The Calcutta High Court has put a hold on the West Bengal government's interim relief program for terminated Group-C and Group-D employees of state-run schools until September 26. This follows a Supreme Court order from April 3 that ended their employment.
title: Kolkata HC stays Didi's relief to SSC staff sacked by SC

author: MANJU V
description: An Air India flight from Delhi to Hong Kong experienced a mid-air door malfunction on June 1st. Passengers endured a shaking door accompanied by hissing noises, prompting flight attendants to use napkins to seal the gap. Similar incidents involving Boeing 787 doors have occurred previously with other airlines.
title: Mid-Air scare: AI's shaking door makes hissing noise; flight lands safely

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amidst escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, old tweets from Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei have resurfaced, drawing online mockery. These decade-old posts, featuring personal anecdotes, contrast sharply with his current war-driven rhetoric. As Khamenei vows resistance and warns the US, the resurfaced tweets add an unexpected layer to the ongoing conflict, sparking a wave of reactions.
title: ‘Naughty and playful?’ Khamenei’s old tweets go viral; internet trolls Supreme Leader

author: DURGESH NANDAN JHA
description: Since 2014, India has observed International Day of Yoga (IDY) every June 21, following a UN resolution proposed by PM Modi. A recent survey reveals that nearly 25% of Indians have incorporated yoga into their lives.
title: Nearly one in every four persons in India incorporating yoga, reveals survey

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' also starring Genelia D’Souza, premiered on June 20th to positive reception, earning Rs. 11.7 crore on its opening day, surpassing 'Taare Zameen Par'. The film's Hindi version led earnings, impacting 'Housefull 5's' box office performance. The plot centers on a basketball coach's community service, training players with intellectual disabilities for a national tournament.
title: Aamir Khan starrer 'Sitaare Zameen Par' takes the reins by minting Rs.11.7 cr

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Dhanush and Nagarjuna's thriller 'Kuberaa' has made a strong debut, earning an impressive Rs 13 crore net in India on its opening day. The Telugu version is leading the charge with remarkable occupancy rates in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, especially during night shows. While the Tamil version showed fair occupancy, particularly in Chennai during evening shows, the film's performance was limited in Kannada, Hindi, and Malayalam.
title: Dhanush-Nagarjuna thriller 'Kuberaa' opens with Rs 13 cr; dominates market

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: R Praggnanandhaa has surpassed D Gukesh in live FIDE rankings, reaching a rating of 2777.2 while competing in the UzChess Cup Masters. He is currently tied for the lead in the tournament after defeating Shamsiddin Vokhidov. Recently, India saw four players in the global top 10, including Aravindh Chithambaram, highlighting the country's growing dominance in chess.
title: Historic! Praggnanandhaa surpasses world champion Gukesh in world rankings

author: TNN
description: An 83-year-old retiree from Dadar fell victim to an elaborate online stock trading scam, losing Rs 1.2 crore. The retiree was lured through a fake platform disguised as a reputable financial institution after clicking on an online advertisement. Cyber police are currently investigating the fraud, tracing IP addresses and financial transactions to identify the perpetrators.
title: Maharashtra man, 83, loses Rs 1.2 crore to fake stock trading portal

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'My intelligence community wrong': Trump slams spy chief Gabbard on Iran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan has nominated Donald Trump for the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize, citing his role in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Trump himself has claimed he deserves the award for multiple peace efforts, including preventing a war between the two nuclear-armed nations. He also announced a peace treaty between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda.
title: Pak nominates Trump for Nobel Peace Prize; cites role in India-Pakistan crisis

author: TNN
description: The Enforcement Directorate's summons to senior advocates Datar and Venugopal drew strong condemnation from legal bodies like the SC Bar Association and SCAORA. They argued the summonses undermine the independence of the bar and attorney-client privilege protected by the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam, 2023. Concerns were raised about a chilling effect on legal professionals providing honest opinions.
title: SC lawyers' body asks ED to respect independence of Bar, exercise restraint

author: TNN
description: In a tragic incident on NH-18 in Purulia, West Bengal, nine people from Jharkhand, including two brothers, died when their SUV collided head-on with a truck while returning from a wedding. The impact of the collision was severe, resulting in the SUV being mangled and all passengers declared dead at a nearby health center.
title: SUV collides with truck, 2 brothers among 9 killed

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sachin Tendulkar recalls India's 2002 Headingley win. He connects it to the current team's strong start. Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal scored centuries. Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, and Sourav Ganguly had centuries in 2002. India amassed a huge total then. Gill and Jaiswal's partnership is promising. Rishabh Pant also contributed well. Fans are eager to see if India can repeat history.
title: 'Who will be 3rd centurion?' Tendulkar recalls 2002 Test after Day 1 domination

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez are reportedly getting married next week in Venice, Italy, with a star-studded guest list. VIP attendees will receive lavish gifts, including hand-blown glassware from Laguna B. Bezos' superyacht, Koru, will be anchored off San Giorgio Maggiore island, which may be closed to visitors. The celebration will feature pastries from Rosa Salva Venetia.
title: Jeff Bezos’ Venice wedding, here's the designer gift 'VIP guests may receive'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Neeraj Chopra clinched his first Diamond League victory in two years in Paris, triumphing over Germany's Julian Weber with an impressive 88.16m throw. This win marks Chopra's first in the Paris leg of the series, overcoming previous second-place finishes. Earlier, Chopra finished second to Weber at the Doha Diamond League.
title: 88.16m! Neeraj Chopra clinches first DL victory in 2 years - Watch throw here

author: TNN
description: In Lawngtlai, Mizoram, auto-rickshaw driver Lalhmingmuana displayed remarkable honesty by returning Rs 17 lakh to a Myanmar businessman who accidentally left the cash in his vehicle. The businessman, upon realizing his loss, frantically searched for the money. Lalhmingmuana, expecting nothing in return, promptly returned to the hotel to hand over the misplaced sum, earning praise for his integrity.
title: Autowallah returns Rs 17 lakh to man who left it behind in 3-wheeler

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal's centuries powered India to a dominant 359 for 3 on Day 1 against England at Headingley. Gill's unbeaten 127, his first outside Asia, and Jaiswal's 101, the first by an Asian opener at the ground, highlighted India's strong start. Rishabh Pant's aggressive 65* further solidified India's imposing position in the opening Test.
title: From Tendulkar-Sehwag to Gill-Jaiswal! Day 1 of Leeds Test rewrites history books

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump announced a peace agreement between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda, brokered with Secretary of State Marco Rubio, aiming to end a long-standing conflict. The deal, initiated at the DRC's request, involves halting hostilities and disarming rebel groups.
title: ‘Great day for Africa’: Trump administration brokers Congo-Rwanda treaty

author: TNN
description: Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. (HAL) has become the first Indian firm to fully acquire the technology for ISRO's Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV) for Rs 511 crore. IN-SPACe announced this complete transfer of technology as a significant milestone, enabling HAL to independently own, build, market, and launch the rocket after an initial two-year period of assistance from ISRO.
title: HAL 1st Indian firm to bag full rocket tech

author: SANDEEP MOUDGAL
description: Karnataka's government is set to establish a social-media regulatory authority to combat fake news and misinformation. The proposed bill, carrying penalties up to seven years in prison and hefty fines, targets content insulting to women, disrespecting Sanatana Dharma, or promoting superstition. Special courts will be formed to address violations, ensuring accountability from companies and individuals involved in spreading misinformation.
title: Karnataka moots 7-yr jail for fake news, 2-5 yrs for misinformation

author: NGATHINGKHUI JAGOI
description: An indefinite shutdown gripped Churachandpur, while Kangpokpi observed a 24-hour closure following the death of a tribal woman, Hoikholhing Haokip, in crossfire between security forces and unidentified gunmen. The incident occurred during an operation launched after a farmer was shot.
title: Life hit in Manipur district as tribal outfit enforces shutdown over woman's death in crossfire

author: TNN
description: In a shocking incident in Ghazipur, a married woman, Priyanka Kumari, was forced to marry her lover, Pintu Gond, at a temple by her husband and villagers. Priyanka, already married to Rohit Kumar, was caught with Pintu, leading to the forced ceremony.
title: UP shocker: Husband forces woman to 'marry' lover; case filed

author: DWAIPAYAN GHOSH
description: A 20-year-old man named Diptendu Bag was apprehended at Entally Police Station for masquerading as a Bengal Police inspector. Bag, dressed in a police uniform and accompanied by his girlfriend, aroused suspicion due to his unusual behavior. His inconsistent answers during questioning and claims of a rapid promotion raised further doubts.
title: Dressed as inspector, 20-year-old visits Kolkata police station to impress girlfriend

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Genpact's new policy mandating a 10-hour workday, effective mid-June, has sparked employee unrest, particularly in Hyderabad. The policy, communicated informally, lacks a base salary increase but offers incentives for meeting the hour requirement and bonuses for exceeding it. Concerns are rising about work-life balance, productivity, and potential burnout due to the extended hours.
title: Genpact to employees: Follow 10-hour workday 'mandate' or face…
